Key Match Events: The Thunder forced 19 turnovers compared to LA's 9, leading to 17 fast break points and 13 points off turnovers.
Oklahoma City's starting five dominated the Clippers, averaging a plus-minus of plus-23.4, while the Clippers' starting five had a minus-21.2 plus-minus.
Post-Match Reflections: Hartenstein, Williams, and Gilgeous-Alexander posted 58 points to help Oklahoma City to an 18-point victory.
Despite being outrebounded, Oklahoma City's knack to make the opposition commit mistakes bridged the gap and secured the win.
